item.title: Python & Greg Fenves
item.description: library(reticulate) ## Warning: package 'reticulate' was built under R version 3.6.3 pres_dict = { 'firstName': 'Greg', 'lastName': 'Fenves', 'hobbies': ['traveling','reading Murakami','art'], 'occupation': ['engineer', 'college president'], 'age': 62 } print(pres_dict) ## {'firstName': 'Greg', 'lastName': 'Fenves', 'hobbies': ['traveling', 'reading Murakami', 'art'], 'occupation': ['engineer', 'college president'], 'age': 62} print(pres_dict.keys()) ## dict_keys(['firstName', 'lastName', 'hobbies', 'occupation', 'age']) print(pres_dict.values()) #values can be anything, not just numbers ## dict_values(['Greg', 'Fenves', ['traveling', 'reading Murakami', 'art'], ['engineer', 'college president'], 62]) pres_dict['hobbies'].
